description:
Cloning, wysiwyg editing, note hoisting, note versioning, internet publishing, canvas notes,........

Man, are you serious. This is an ambitious project and I hope it's one that can be maintained as it picks up users. This is going to be, no doubt, the most advanced tree structured writing and journaling software available to GnuLinux users. After having used applications such as "UltraRecall" and "TreeDBNotes Pro" on the Winddows side, I can say this is a unique project.

I have not run into unmanageable problems with Trilium as I get to know its functionaliies and no doubt I'll find surprises, but the concept is unique and well organized through a beautiful interface and I thought for that alone it deserves 5 start.
i hope this application draws the attention of avid note users.

remek app, föleg úgy hogy saját szervert is lehet futtatni, böven elegendö funkcióval rendelkezik, hogy bármire is jó legyen ami a jegyzetelést vagy írást foglal magába. nem utolsó sorban pedig kis css és minden csodás. végül pedig a demót mindenképp érdemes átnézni megnézni mi-hogy müködik - a leghasznosabb demó amivel valaha találkozam.
ájánlom mindenkinek és bárkinek aki írni szeretne.

Has all the bells and whistle: Backlinking, tree-like structure, multimedia notes, extendability, portability, self-hostable online synching, open source (on AGPL3 no less) with (as of time of writing) a real discussion about project governance and moving from solo dev to community-owned.

I've been looking for an open source alternative to obsidian. This is it and it seems amazing. I'm still getting to know the tools, but everything looks great so far! I hope many users join and support the devs. Thank you very much! Will donate.
Only installed, didn't have time to give it a change, yet, already see "Potentially unsafe" flag in Flatpak, which makes me feel a bit upset about open source app which looks great.

This note taking app was what I have been looking for for years. It is approachable for new users and has LOTS of power-user features and shortcuts. The ability to sync multiple clients with a backend server is very nice.

The only downside is that there is no mobile client (yet?). The mobile interface is good enough for now.

I tried several apps in the past like notion,obsidian,logseq,roam research etc. Trilium wipes the floor with all of them. This is the only app that solves real problems that are associated with hierarchical organizers which is one note can have multiple parents.
summary: OMG this is the best note app ever!

description: This app is awesome. 6 months ago I just went and try it out. No expectations. Still using it. It's flexible and reliable. Simple but powerful. Good job guys!
summary: No BS. It does what it should do and more

description: This is the number one note, web clipper multipuerpose app I have ever used. Better than Joplin.

I use Trilium for a couple of years now and it has been reliable. I even run a server instance to sync between my desktop and laptop. It has been reliable.

It is a good app for documenting private projects and notes. It allows for rich structured notes with file and image attachments.

I wish there was a mobile client but server instance does work well enough for occassional mobile access.
I was just looking for alternatives to Cherrytree and found gold
